evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

pairwise_discriminators.R1_PUSHBACK_PROCEDURAL_DEVIATION|R2_COMM: Evidence that the active tug instructor passed the TRP while still controlling pushback supports R1; evidence that TRP stop-state was not shared/understood before exceedance supports R2.
pairwise_discriminators.R1_PUSHBACK_PROCEDURAL_DEVIATION|R3_ENVI: If crew recognized the TRP and expected stopping but motion continued, R1 dominates; if TRP visibility/placement was inadequate enough to explain the miss absent attention lapse, R3 dominates.
pairwise_discriminators.R1_PUSHBACK_PROCEDURAL_DEVIATION|R4_MECH: Passing the TRP without corroborated malfunction supports R1; verified braking/control faults or repeatable failure signatures support R4.
pairwise_discriminators.R2_COMMUNICATION_BREAKDOWN|R3_ENVIRONMEN: Assumption/deference and failure to challenge despite cues supports R2; inadequate TRP marking/visibility as the key miss mechanism supports R3.
pairwise_discriminators.R2_COMMUNICATION_BREAKDOWN|R4_MECHANICAL: Coordination failures without hardware evidence support R2; fault codes, tests, or repeat malfunctions support R4.
pairwise_discriminators.R3_ENVIRONMENT_OR_MARKING_DEFICIENCY|R4_: Physical marking salience/location deficiencies support R3; corroborated control-system malfunction evidence supports R4.

roots.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root
roots.statement: Primary pushback control lapse: active tug instructor failed to stop at TRP. NEC: The required TRP stop/release point was reached but not complied with; Pushback movement continued beyond TRP until blast-fence contact

roots.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root
roots.statement: Primary coordination failure: challenge/alert breakdown among ground crew. NEC: Crew held divergent assumptions about stop-state or intent; No timely effective challenge or stop warning occurred despite cues

roots.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root
roots.statement: Primary environmental/marking deficiency at TRP. NEC: TRP marking visibility/prominence/placement was inadequate; The marking deficiency plausibly caused or materially enabled the TRP miss

roots.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root
roots.statement: Primary mechanical or control-system failure. NEC: A tug or aircraft control/braking malfunction affected stopping; Corroboration exists via tests, diagnostics, or repeat failures
